page.title: 18THANINGTON'S POST BUS AREA
page.content: {New House Lane}has a community of about 100 dwellings, mostly post-war houses and bungalows. In 1951 the residents raised money to build a hall, the only local amenity, for social activites now also serving as the church of St. Faith. The lane is served only by the{Post Bus}which, since 1972, has operated as a passen- ger service between Canterbury, Crundale and Godmersham. The mini bus, a Leyland Sherpa, with seating capa- city for 11 passengers, is ideal for negotiating the narrow lanes. It makes two journeys a day. The driver delivers mail on the outward journey and collects from the Post Boxes on the return journey. The driver will also collect stamped mail from resi- dents. Sometimes the bus is used as a means of admiring the countryside.
